title: Iodine-Loaded Albumin Nanoparticles for X-ray Computed Tomography (CT) and Iodine-Enhanced Radiation Therapy (I-ERT)
content: Because of their large size, multivalency, multi-functionality, and ability to carry large payloads nanoparticles (NPs, diameter between 1-100 nm) have found applications in the areas of imaging, diagnosis, and therapy [1,2]. NP-based agents tend to stay in the blood-pool for a longer period and enable temporal imaging [1,2]. Further, hypervascularization of the abnormal tumor tissue leads to selective accumulation of NPs in tumors by much debated enhanced permeability and retention [EPR] effect, that is being exploited for targeted tumor therapy [3].
